author: tgannon
title: Monaco Prince shocks fans at Manchester City clash by wearing half and half scarf for Champions League knockout

organizations.name: manchester united kante keep him away n'golo kante

text:
EFL Disloyal royal Monaco Prince shocks fans at Manchester City clash by wearing half and half scarf for Champions League knockout 
Albert II loomed over the European tie from an executive box at the Stade Louis II wearing BOTH clubs' sets of colours Pictured 15th March 2017, 10:20 pm Updated: 15th March 2017, 11:10 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MONACO’S Prince shocked fans by wearing a half and half scarf for the Champions League knockout clash against Manchester City. 
Albert II loomed over the French leaders’ European showdown against Pep Guardiola’s side from an executive box at the Stade Louis II. Getty Images Prince Albert II wore a half and half scarf for Monaco’s clash with Manchester City 
But supporters were amazed to see him sporting the colours of their RIVALS for the night. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Champions League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The royal, who turned 59 yesterday, may have been given the scarf as a birthday present by City chairman Khaldoon al-Mubarak – who sat next to him for the tie. 
While Prince Albert II may have worn surprising attire during the game, there is no doubt he will be wearing a smile afterwards. 
They join the likes of Real Madrid, Barcelona and Leicester in the draw for the last eight. Getty Images Prince Albert II sits with Manchester City chairman Khaldoon al-Mubarak during the match MOST READ IN FOOTBALL Liverpool and Arsenal fear being robbed of Champions League spot by Manchester United and Leicester Ron's Real nemesis Cristiano Ronaldo and a host of Real Madrid stars' futures could be under threat as Monchi comes in CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Hilarious moment Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp for interrupting his expert analysis on Sky Sports Brawl in Brazil Chaos in Brazil as local derby erupts into a mass fight between players and fans out on their own Luke Shaw, Anthony Martial and Bastian Schweinsteiger sent to train on their own at Manchester United Kante Keep Him Away N'Golo Kante celebrates Leicester's Champions League win over Sevilla from King Power stands Friend of Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus cracks up seeing him on mobility scooter
